Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you, a silent youth sits cross-legged, shaping tiny clay lions beside a crude shrine. His fingers are stained ochre; traces of clay mark his cheeks and lips.

He meets your gaze with bright, knowing eyes and gestures—tapping his chest, touching the earth, then pressing clay to his lips.
A scrawled note reads: “I listen for the kami in the clay. Will you listen too?”

Option.text: Can you sculpt me a guardian?
Sit quietly with Inari and observe.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari nods solemnly. He pats a pouch of sacred earth, then presses a finger to his lips and closes his eyes.
On a slate, he writes: “Clay remembers. The kami whisper through earth shaped by kind hands. A little taste, and I hear them better.”

Option.text: I would try the clay, if it is safe.
That’s unusual, but I respect your ways.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari smiles and shakes his head, showing a charm of dried blossoms and rice hung on his belt.
“Only sacred clay. Never common mud. Kaoru blesses it.”

Option.text: What do you hear from the kami?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari’s eyes widen. He carefully offers a pinch of pale clay on a leaf.
You taste earth—warm, strangely calming.

For a moment, you hear distant whispers: “Minax’s shadow creeps. Clay lions must wake.”

Option.text: I feel strange… but in a good way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari closes his eyes, shaping a lion from clay. On his slate, he writes:
“The kami warn of evil spirits—cultists who hate my guardians. Will you help protect the shrine?”

Option.text: Yes, I will protect you and your shrine.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari beams, bows deeply, and selects a lump of clay. With nimble hands, he shapes it into a guardian lion.
He holds it up: “For protection. Place near door. But…” He hesitates, glancing nervously around.
“Some hate the kami. Bad people watch me.”

Option.text: May I have the guardian lion?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari nods, pressing the small clay lion into your palm. A warm sensation fills you as you hold it.
“Kami watch over you.”

Inari nods, miming fierce claws and a silent roar.
“Keep evil away. Only if made with good heart.”

Inari looks around, eyes wide, then writes shakily:
“Bad people. They fear the guardians. Sometimes at night, they try to break the shrine.”

Inari sketches a symbol: a twisted red spiral.
“Minax cult. Hate kami. Want darkness.” He hands you a small clay token: “If you see this, danger is near.”

Option.text: I will watch for the sign.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari scrawls in haste:
“She hates harmony. Her cult breaks shrines, steals clay, silences kami.”
He bows his head, silent grief on his face.

Option.text: This is too dangerous for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari bows, gratitude shining in his eyes.
He presses a clay amulet into your hand.
“Place by shrine at sunset. The kami will test your heart.”

The earth feels warmer beneath your feet.
A whisper echoes faintly: “Protect the innocent, and the kami will remember.”
Inari offers a shy smile, returning to his clay. The sound of soft chanting and gentle shaping fills the air.

Option.text: Sit quietly with Inari and observe.

Dialogue.NPCText:
You sit in silence. Inari molds a fresh lion, humming tunelessly.
For a moment, the world is peaceful, and the shrine’s lanterns seem to burn a little brighter.

Option.text: Ask Inari about his clay lions.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari tilts his head, then draws a small figure in the dirt—childlike, alone, under a tree.
He points to it, then to himself.

He scrawls: "Orphan. Found after fire. Shrine ashes. Only kami spoke to me."

Option.text: How did you come to sculpt guardians?
Do you ever wish to speak with words?
You’ve been through much. I honor your strength.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari draws spirals—flames, a collapsed roof, a single survivor’s mark.
"Minax cult destroyed Tokuno shrine. Said kami were lies. I hid. Listened. Learned clay speaks." He touches his lips, then the ground.

Option.text: I’m sorry you had to endure that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari grins faintly, taps his belly, and holds up a tiny clay bowl.
"A shrine mouse fed me. Clay kept me warm."
He nods solemnly. "Kami hide in small things."

Option.text: Tell me more about the kami in clay.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari shapes a lion quickly, then a turtle, then a child’s face. He smiles, proud.
"Each form has a soul. Not alive… but not empty."
He scribbles: "When I mold with peace in my heart, they protect. When I rush, they crumble."

Option.text: I sculpt too. (if player has high Tinkering or Carpentry)
Option.action: SendMessage:Inari watches your hands with interest.

Option.text: Can you teach me to sculpt?
That explains why they feel alive...

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari watches your fingers, mimicking their motion. He nods eagerly.
"Hands that shape kindly are hands that shape safely."
He gifts you a tiny unbaked lump of clay.

Inari tilts his head, considering. Then he gestures: one hand flat, the other molding above it.
"Sit. Watch. Then try. But first…"
He presses his hands together: "Thank the kami."

Option.text: Maybe later. I respect your art, though.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari hands you a bowl of sacred clay.
"Shape. Listen. Do not force."
(You begin learning the spirit of guardian crafting.)

Inari places a finger gently over his lips, then shrugs, smiling with peace.
"Words are loud. Clay is patient. I don’t need more than that."

Option.text: You speak clearly through your hands.
Have you ever dreamed of speaking aloud?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari gazes upward. He draws a speech bubble filled with stars.
"Maybe in dreams. But silence lets me hear the world better."

Option.text: That’s a powerful way to live.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Inari bows deeply, then resumes sculpting with calm focus.
The clay in his fingers pulses faintly, as if warmed by gratitude.

Option.text: May the kami guide your hands.
